Reviews.Title: Great tablet, but is actually the "Light" version
Reviews.Author: Orthodoc
Reviews.Content: I bought the S6000 tablet from Lenovo.com directly, rather than this version offered, as they offer a 32GB hard-drive memory.  This version states only 16GB.  In any case, I am extremely satisfied with this tablet, and find it to be a great alternative to the iPad.  It is just as thin, but with a larger screen and better price.  I personally find the Android platform much easier to navigate, switch between windows, change the settings, and frankly, a whole lot easier to download apps!  No username, no password, no hassle.  Only when you first turn it on to use, is it slower than the iPad.  But, if it has only been dormant, then it activates just as fast.Lenovo.com notes 2 versions:  S6000 and S6000L.  The 'L' version does not have a rear-facing camera or micro-HDMI port.  It has only 16GB hard-drive memory.  Their S6000 version has 32GB hard-drive, has front and rear-facing cameras & the HDMI port.  I do not understand why this version offered states that it has only 16GB hard-drive.  In addition, the specs listed do not note the front-facing camera, although the written description does mention it.  However, both versions can take a MicroSD card, to add memory, and have a micro-USB port for charging or attaching accessories.  (Et tu, Apple?).Also, I bought the matching Lenovo Bluetooth keyboard / magnetic cover (on Amazon for about 1/2 of list price), made specifically for this tablet by Lenovo.  It supports the tablet for surfing, reading, emails, and so forth.  It neatly attaches magnetically, which automatically puts the tablet into dormant (sleep) mode immediately, saving the battery, as well as protecting the screen.  No need for any additional cover.

Reviews.Title: My First Tablet, But Not My First Rodeo
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "jebert6"
Reviews.Content: Although I had not owned a tablet prior to purchasing my S6000 a few weeks ago, I had listened closely to friends, family, and colleagues about their experiences with a variety of different makes and models of tablets.  I then did extensive research on the tablets available that met my criteria (screen size, weight, processor speed, onboard storage, and screen clarity) and fell into my price range ($200-$350).  I did various comparisons on Best Buy's site, Amazon, Office Depot, etc; all of which pointed me to the S6000.  So, I bought it and haven't regretted it one moment since.  It works flawlessly, doesn't get stymeid by multiple apps running, and feels great in my hands.  If you choose to buy the S6000, then you truly must consider getting the very inexpensive, but invaluable Lenovo keyboard (Bluetooth).  On Amazon its only around $30-$40 (new) and works beautifully.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: K. Williams
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd Lenovo tablet, I've also had the 7 inch and 8.9 inch.  I've had this now for over a month.  Love the bigger screen and the lightweight feel, yet sturdy construction.  Also, faster than my previous tablets, and just such a great buy for a 10 inch screen.  I love the HDMI port, my 8.9 inch had one as well and I've found very few tablets that actually have it.  I caught mine on sale at $199.99 on Amazon, but at $219 still think it's a steal considering the size and quality.  The only complaint I can possibly come up with is that they came out with an even lower priced 10 inch screen when my 8.9 inch was perfectly fine.  Thrilled with that extra 1.1 inch - really a great great buy!  Thanks Lenovo!!

Reviews.Title: Very happy with this.
Reviews.Author: A. Alexander
Reviews.Content: Just received this tablet and have been using it over the weekend.  No complaints at all.  Screen looks great and is very responsive - all my apps run smoothly - Netflix video looks sharp. Bottom line, for 200 bucks - you can surf the web fast, watch video, and enjoy a 10 inch screen.  Great deal and highly recommend.  Also - the battery life seems to be better than I expected.

Reviews.Title: Lenovo S6000 Tablet nice but....
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have been using this tablet for just over a week now and so far so good, until....I went to play a movie on Netflix and everything worked well until I hit PLAY. I got audio with a blank screen. I even got the closed captioning text on the screen but no picture. I then went online to determine if the issue is a Netflix issue or a Lenovo S6000 tablet issue. Apparently other owners of this tablet have experienced this same issue with no apparent resolution in sight.Its great to make a purchase of a product that does everything it is supposed to do. Unfortunately this tablet does not and I am curious about what other issues I will discover.

Reviews.Title: nice product
Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: item we can watch anything in my tv and movies all I can do any work nice product for my home

Reviews.Title: AWESOME
Reviews.Author: JN in OK
Reviews.Content: AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME !  light weight and handy.  Very easy to use and good picture.  Also very bright.  Runs well

Reviews.Title: Great tablet!!!
Reviews.Author: Mary Anne Johnson
Reviews.Content: Love this tablet and what a great price!Highly recommended.  Bought one for my son and another for my brother.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful and practical!
Reviews.Author: Beelissa
Reviews.Content: I got this tablet for my non-techy husband, and he *loves* it! It is easy to use and he likes the big screen. True, there are 10-inch tablets out there with screens that have much higher resolutions than this one (and you'll pay more for them, too). But the screen is more than adequate. It connects just fine to WiFi and is fast enough for what we need it to do. It is *very* thin -- I'm not sure I've seen a tablet as thin as this one is.One thing to note: the dimensions are odd. This does not affect use at all, but it's something to keep in mind if you want to buy a case. You'll do best looking for a case that is made for this model Lenovo Ideatab. It's taller and narrower than the iPad or the Kindle Fire, so you'll have a hard time getting a generic-sized case (one-case fits many models) to fit it. The thinness of the tablet makes that even more true. We found a really nice one on Amazon made by Poetic.

Reviews.Title: awesome!!
Reviews.Author: Mehmet
Reviews.Content: just over $200  for a Lenovo.  anyone who knows anyting about quality knows Lenovo Is the top of the line.  I bought this for a kid for his bday, first tablet for him.  Im gonna buy one for myself now.  way better than a galaxy in my opinion,  and ipads are useless without extra ports and the ability to play FLASH.  ill be back for another.

Reviews.Title: It's a great deal if you can live without separate user accounts
Reviews.Author: Sherri D.
Reviews.Content: I've had this tablet for a few days, and I really love it. It was a good price and looks and feels beautiful. I'm using it for school--specifically, accessing my e-textbook--and it works just like I expected. The display is crisp and responsive, and the battery lasts long enough for me to do my homework and then let the kids play on it for a couple of hours.The reason it is 4 stars instead of 5 is that even though the Android version is Jellybean 4.2.2 and should have the ability to make multiple user accounts, Lenovo apparently doesn't have this option for this tablet. I'm hoping they will remedy this soon, since I'd like my kids to be able to play games without being all up in my stuff, but in product forums I see they've been asking for a remedy for about six months, so I'm not holding my breath. For the price, it's not a deal breaker.

Reviews.Title: Nice tablet. Nice price.
Reviews.Author: Ham-one
Reviews.Content: Bright, crisp screen. Relatively fast. Speakers sound great too. Very good battery life. No issues thus far. Very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: value for money
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey
Reviews.Content: this is not a top model. but it is of reasonable quality. weight is acceptable. smoothit has no GPS, to my surprise. can't connect to the internet via Bluetooth tethering.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent Tablet, especially for the price I paid. It was given as a Christmas present to replace an older dying tablet bought 2 years ago, this was cheaper than what I paid back then and is definitely better by far. Netflix did not work out of the box, but a simple Firmware update from the built in utility had it up and running in less than 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: USB connect and HDMI do not work.
Reviews.Author: cathy nyein
Reviews.Content: Good tablet.  I only gave it 3 of 5 stars because the USB connect to a PC does to work.  I deducted another star be cause the HDMI out does not work either.  Otherwise, I would have rated 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: andriod better than i-pad
Reviews.Author: Marianne Hornung
Reviews.Content: I have a friend who has an i-pad and I like this Android better.  Easier to download.  I had a hard time finding a cover for it.  The one I purchased wasn't made for it so I CAN'T TAKE PICTURES WITH IT WHILE IT'S IN THE CASE.

Reviews.Title: Lenovo Ideatab S6000 10.1-Inch 16GB Tablet (Black)
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: Pro:  Fast startup;  fast;  16GB huge memory;  able to connect to HDTV via microHDMI;  have microSD card slot;  can be charged via USB.Con:  Certain apps still keep crashing or not working.Lenovo Ideatab S6000 10.1-Inch 16GB Tablet.  I have been using this tablet for 4 months and I'm loving it.  Fast and responsive.  Able to turn it on real quick (about less than 20 sec)... at this time, probably that because I don't have that many apps that boot at the startup.  It has huge memory, 16GB; in addition, I can add more storage by inserting microSD card.  I can connect this tablet to any monitor or tv with HDMI slot.  Battery life is good enough... about 6 hours.I think that it is durable.  It can tolerate bumps and thuds.  But of course I take extra care handling this tablet.I like that I can charge this tablet via USB slot from computer/battery packs, DC, or AC.  I can also transfer files and stuff from computer to tablet or vice versa.Some apps don't work or keeps crashing.  Well, probably those apps are at fault, because they also crashed in my phone or other tablets.

Reviews.Title: Great starter or child's tablet
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet as a starter tablet for my son.  He had been asking for one for quite some time and when Christmas came he received a different brand.  Sadly, it did not work and it needed to be returned.  As I was extremely dissatisfied with the quality of the other tablet,  I began looking at and reviewing various other brands and options.This tablet represents a good middle ground.  It is far superior to the 100 dollar cheap tablets you find, and it doesn't cost 500 dollars like some of the premier tablets.  This tablet has been very stable, connects to wife easily,  does not freeze up, and does everything it is asked to do.If you are not interested in dropping 500 on one of the new Samsung Galaxy Tablets, or other high quality and highly promoted brand name tablet, I would definitely recommend this one.  I already have 4 other children asking for one...  And I will almost certainly purchase this exact tablet for them when the appropriate holiday or special occasion arrives.

Reviews.Title: Major Problems with Lenovo S6000 Tablet
Reviews.Author: Art Deno
Reviews.Content: This has major issues right out of the box. Tablet continually crashes/freezes up. Checked the Lenovo web site regarding issue. The only recommendation was to do a factory reset. Tried that the problem was worse. I don't recommend this tablet.However, Amazon.com has been excellent regarding the issue. Thank you Amazon.com. Excellent customer service.

Reviews.Title: great tablet, wonderful Lenovo quality
Reviews.Author: Edison "hightech lover"
Reviews.Content: I did not buy from here, since I find our local B store carries it at $245.First thing I did was to update its software by go to setup app.I forgot to turn it off, two days later, the battery still alive but need charge ASAP. After fully charged it again, I turn it on when I needed, turn it off when I don't need, it last a week for my not frequent use.I put in a 64GB micro SD Kingston HC card, it immediately recognize it and showed up as 63GB SD card storage.  I am still playing with it and decide the best way to partition the large storage I have.  When connect to the PC, please take a look on the top left corner, there is a small USB icon.  This will allows you to use this same USB port to connect to an external USB hdd, or allow computer to connect to this tablet as external flash drive.  I changed that to media drive, so that my Windows 7 PC will show this tablet as an storage.If you have a CallCentric SIP account, you can also install a sip phone client, like LinPhone free app, then this tablet will act like a real phone. You can call and receive call from this tablet, as long as you have wifi connection.  There is a google voice app, but that will not allow you to make or receive phone call from this.  Rather just provides you another phone number.  I found CallCentric dirty cheap number is very good. I was able to make and receive calls when I was on an oversea trip.I love the Lenovo quality. They are very lasting and tolerate abuses.

Reviews.Title: Can't beat it for the money
Reviews.Author: Sir Shots Alot "Mount P"
Reviews.Content: There are nicer tablets out there but I haven't seen any nicer than this one less than $350. Good solid tablet no lag handles basic functions well.  I have owned the original Galaxy tablet, BlackBerry PlayBook, Acer Icona, Chinese made Herotab and this is the best of all so far. Before you spend over $250, I would definitely give this tablet a thorough study. If this tablet did cost $350, I would give it 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: Very nice, esp if you are technically comfortable experimenting
Reviews.Author: unhuman
Reviews.Content: This is a decent tablet.  It is replacing an iPad.  For $200 instead of $500, it's a pretty solid deal.  Tablet is fast.  Plays games.  Very well.  Very nice IPS display.Some things are annoying though:1. Application list isn't sorted alphabetically.  Only sorts by install time (or I can't figure out how to change it).  A better index makes it easier to find apps that are installed and you want to put on the home screen or uninstall.2. The Lenovo UI on top of Android looks nice, but the folders they provide do not work as cleanly as one would expect.  They're nice, but could be better.3. Resolution could be higher, but it's adequate and expected at this price point.  And, of course I knew that going in.The Android 4.2.2 does not let you use App2SD.  I had to root mine and then I use Link2SD and FolderMount (paid version) to shift applications to the SD card.  This requires partitioning the SD card, I made mine 85% FAT32 and 15% ext4.  Reason being is that FolderMount pushes data only to the first partition, while Link2SD uses the 2nd part.  Since most new games are mostly large data, that strategy seems like it will work for me.The hack requirement is due to Google locking down Android more than it used to...  But, at least there's this workaround.If it all worked out of the box and required no manual manipulation, I'd give it 5.  If you don't plan on using lots of apps, 5 stars as well.If you're uncomfortable rooting your tablet and messing with SD cards, then it probably is 3 stars for you.

Reviews.Title: Good, but not the best.
Reviews.Author: R.D.
Reviews.Content: I was very happy when I bought it. I had worked on it for about three weeks. The quality of the picture is not very good, butit is expected with a 10'' tablet from this class. It has great colors, the movement between the screens is good.I had a problem though - brighter spots all over the screen, so I had to return it.Other thing I didn't like was that after a week, it started getting a little slower. And no, I didn't have a lot of apps, and they didn't need an update. It just started getting slower.Overall my opinion of it is good, for the money I paid ($250 in the beggining of August) and it's worth it if you pay up to $300, just because the size of it. But it's far from perfection.

Reviews.Title: good tablet for price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This Lenovo replaces an Asus Nexus 7 which I loved and used a great deal until the power cord sheered off.  It was a faulty design with a cable that was too thin--that is another story.  I couldn't be happier with the Lenova for several reasons I will list1.  It charged very quickly2.  Holds the charge well3.  Seamlessly and quickly loaded all apps and content4.  It feels sturdy and the cable is thicker than my previous tablet (although I wish it were longer)5.  Very easy to use6.  Compared to other tablets and what you get with this the price is greatI've not yet found any down sides or issues

Reviews.Title: love my tablet!
Reviews.Author: Yolanda Fearon
Reviews.Content: I got this tablet for an excellent price! It practically looked brand new. The only issue I had was the charging port. It was loose. The seller offered for me to return it & I would receive a refund. But I really wanted to tablet so I calles Lenovo to find out if the tablet still was covered under warranty and it was! All is well and my charger port was repaired.

Reviews.Title: best tablet out there better than samsung
Reviews.Author: weng wong
Reviews.Content: best tablet zero problem half the price of i pad you wont regret buy had for four month now no problem also order the oem coverfrom lenovo 10.00 including shipping

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Amalia
Reviews.Content: Very good tablet, it really works well is quick and easy to use. I recommend it. Happy that i chose this product

Reviews.Title: so far very good?
Reviews.Author: Mr. Real Fortin Sr.
Reviews.Content: for the price i think it's hard to beat this unit,HDMI.Usb,audio ,can watch tv with it the HDMI or plug it  to your pc to transfer file back & forth would recommend if you don't wqnt to spend your fortune on a ipad for what .Ray

Reviews.Title: Great choice
Reviews.Author: Mike K
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my parents birthday! Mom loves it! Slim, sleek design. Good sound. Runs smooth. Just as good as my Samsung galaxy Note 3 tab.

Reviews.Title: Yes! Lots of bang for your buck!
Reviews.Author: BassCliff "BassCliff"
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet when it was $219. I see the price has gone up a little but this is still a good deal for the hardware, screen size, resolution, and features you get versus an iPad or full blown Windows tablet. The Andriod OS (4.2.2 Jelly Bean) is pretty intuitive and very responsive on this platform. The app store (Google Play) is easy to use, it's simple to find and install all your favorite apps.I have one nit-picky little complaint. The Bluetooth keyboard I bought bundled seems to time out too quickly. I'm sure there's a setting in the preferences to make the timeout longer. But I haven't found a convenient way to reconnect it after a timeout other than going into the Bluetooth settings and touching the paired keyboard entry again. It connects instantly but it's a little inconvenient to stop what I'm doing to go back into the settings.On a positive note, the performance of this tablet is impressive. Apps, pictures, documents, etc, load almost instantly. I've never had a problem connecting to wifi hotspots or email accounts, both of which I have numerous. The native apps are very good at playing music, viewing pictures, managing files, web surfing, etc. But we all have our favorite apps for those tasks and all of mine run just fine on this platform.All in all, I've been waiting a long time for a machine that does what I want for a price I'm willing to pay. This tablet fit the bill. I suggest getting the suggested bundle of cover, keyboard, and an additional SD card for extra storage. They all work well together. I even bought a microUSB adaptor so that I can attach thumbdrives or other external media, and a microHDMI adaptor so that I can attach the tablet to a TV or monitor. This is a great hardware package. I've made my living in the IT service and support profession for over 30 years and I highly recommend this tablet.

Reviews.Title: A gift for my boyfriend.
Reviews.Author: Jana
Reviews.Content: I asked my boyfriend to rate his tablet since it was a Christmas gift I purchased for him and he said 5 stars. He uses it everyday. Says he has no problem with it running slow. It also has a great battery life. He only charges it once or twice a week. It's a really good tablet for the price. Glad I bought it!!

Reviews.Title: Worked well in one month and 3days... After that...screen problems happened
Reviews.Author: WAN TING SU
Reviews.Content: Worked well in one month and 3days... After that...screen problems happened! Also, every time when I tried to type fast...keyboard stop working!!

Reviews.Title: Replacing Kindle
Reviews.Author: dustin
Reviews.Content: I bought the Lenovo tablet to replace my s***ty kindle Fire. Great, fast performance, almost no hickups or random crashes like I experienced with my kindle. Great resolution, light weight, and durable. Another great product from Lenovo. Also, said it would ship in a week, but was at my door step in 2 days.

Reviews.Title: Wife loves this device.
Reviews.Author: thedogmmm
Reviews.Content: Wife wanted a tablet to replace her aging and failing Fire.  This device has provided all she has wanted, a large screen, good performance for games, support for her favorite apps, especially for reading e-books.  Hoping the charging port on this holds up better than the ones on her previous Fires.

Reviews.Title: using it now
Reviews.Author: leppard
Reviews.Content: I love my lenovo......it does everything I want it to at a great price! Don't be afraid to order you don't be sorry

Reviews.Title: Great Tab!
Reviews.Author: Diego Hdez
Reviews.Content: I you're looking for a 10" tab and don't want to spend a lot of money this is a great option!

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: xio
Reviews.Content: This table is a dream, great, I love it, very nice as described, I am very pleased with this beautiful table.

Reviews.Title: HDMI Out does not work
Reviews.Author: Mr. R. S. Thomas
Reviews.Content: HDMI out doesn't work. Tried on all ports on two different display devices (My Razor Maxx works fine). Looking into it, this appears to be a common problem and their solution is to have you ship it back. Not acceptable for a brand new device. End-users should not be quality control. Otherwise appears to be a nice device.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for the kids
Reviews.Author: Carlos Reyes "Los"
Reviews.Content: Purchased the tab for my kids. Played with it at Best Buy and I personally fell in love with it. I am more in to the high ends specs for my devices and this tablet doesn't have does type of specs. But for the price tag and the modest specs it carries it was a perfect choice for my kids. The screen is good, gaming is nice as well, video play back is excellent to. There are some things that i noticed do. First, there are two updates waiting for you, it wont upgrade your os to 4.4 nor 4.3 they are patches for what I could read only, since I found out that there was some issues with Netflix not playing well. Second, my wife freaked out with this one, the screen just turned static white and she tough that our kids had screwed up the tab, but I did a quick reboot and the screen was fine. What I found out is that the cable that came with the tab was bad and was making the screen go crazy, so I changed the cable and no more issues after that. So far my kids have being enjoying the tab, playing games and lots of Netflix. I purchased the Lenovo bluetooth keyboard along the Lenovo case to go along with the tab and its a perfect combo.

Reviews.Title: A speedy device
Reviews.Author: ttapW
Reviews.Content: I owed several tablets ranging from cheaper makes to nexus 7. This is a speedy tablet that i am very pleased with.

Reviews.Title: Fair Buy.
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: This Tablet is a fair buy, it is not loaded with "bloat ware" either. The battery was drained on arrival so had to charge it about 4.5 hours. I did notice after plugging it in a scrambled up lenovo display on startup, only happens when turning on tablet while charging. The charge cable should have been longer too. Overall I think this tablet will hold up with a case and the performance is suitable for everyday use.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the hassle. Poor quality.
Reviews.Author: Mike O.
Reviews.Content: Bought in late July. Had issues with HDMI not playing over TV. Bluetooth never worked. Got thru to tech support 3 times. They had me update and reset and neither worked. Took two calls to get that done since they hung up on me twice. Tried finding fixes online and now lenovos own forum discusses the problem. Motherboard bad. So I call thinking they can solve problem now that they know about it and guess what? Its out of warranty now. I asked if since I called over a month ago about issue will they cover it? No record of my calls!!! Guess my cell bill is wrong too!! Not worth it. Other tabs in same price range worth trying. Wish Amazon would help with issue.

Reviews.Title: Update On My tab
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Welch
Reviews.Content: Good day I have only collected my tab today, since i was awaiting my In law to bring same to me, however i hope to enjoy the best of my Tab.

Reviews.Title: tablet works ok
Reviews.Author: Asim khan
Reviews.Content: its working good and the speed is ok.when you are using it, it doesn't freeze dats wat I like about it

Reviews.Title: 10 days old, broken screen
Reviews.Author: james
Reviews.Content: Thing runs great, but some apps don't run on it like some banking apps and groupon, as well as a few others. SCREEN SUCKS! I've had this thing for 10 days and cracked the screen. Didn't drop it. Literally just placed it on a table come back,broken screen. luckily I have squaretrqde so I'll get back to update.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Gabriela Ojeda
Reviews.Content: I couldn't use it so much, I was able to update the OS, Is thinner and has nice design. Screen could be higher (that is for lenovo :D )

Reviews.Title: Speed is okay but it has issues
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: Pretty fast but sometimes it freezes up when watching youtube videos.Even more irritating is that according to their tech support the motherboard gets overcharged when it is left recharging overnight.  When this happens the machine powers up but is frozen.  Have to hold down the power button for a hard close then keep holding it for 20 seconds while it tries to restart three times.  After that it will work.....but wtf.  Cheap Chinese product I guess.

Reviews.Title: Bright House TV App Doesn't Work
Reviews.Author: Steven M. Mckinney "smma"
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet specifically to run the Bright House TV app that allows you to watch live TV. The app loads and starts but when you select programming you get the spinning circle and it times out. Went on Lenovo's forum and found that others are having the same issue. I would recommed you read the Lenovo Ideapad forum prior to purchase. There are many complaints about the S6000 and other models of the Ideapad line. One major complaint seems to be that Lenovo never updates to the newest versions of Android. You are stuck with whatever is loaded on the unit when you buy. If I'd have read the forum before purchase I would have looked elsewhere. Sad because it seems to be a pretty good tablet (besides the issues noted) and had all the features I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: Not satisfaid with the product
Reviews.Author: Carlos Cardozo
Reviews.Content: Is too limited in functionalities. Did not cover my expectations. In summary I disliked the product and do not recommend.

Reviews.Title: unresposive
Reviews.Author: Yesu Kumar matta
Reviews.Content: On day 2 it started acting up, touch screen becomes unresponsive, need to turn it off completely to make it responsive, had a very BSD experience, I won't suggest it to any one
